meanings.definition: To surpass in serving or providing a service.
meanings.sent1: She outserved all the other waiters by always being attentive to customers' needs.
meanings.sent2: The new restaurant outserved its competitors by offering faster delivery times.
meanings.sent3: The robot waiter outserved the human waiters by never forgetting an order.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to customer satisfaction outserved any previous employee.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's ability to outserved any villain made them a legend in the city.

meanings.definition: To exceed in performance or achievement.
meanings.sent1: The athlete outserved his personal best time in the race.
meanings.sent2: The student outserved all expectations by acing the difficult exam.
meanings.sent3: The cat outserved the dog in jumping over the obstacle course.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outserved her own limitations inspired others.
meanings.sent5: The team's unity outserved any individual effort in winning the championship.
